headline: Arrachera (Mexican Skirt Steak for Tacos)
description: This arrachera recipe makes flavorful skirt steak tacos. A Mexican specialty, the beef is marinated in sazón and adobo seasoning, lime, and beer.
name: Arrachera (Mexican Skirt Steak for Tacos)
recipeIngredient: 3 (.18 ounce) packets sazon with coriander and annatto
1 tablespoon adobo seasoning (such as Goya® All-Purpose Seasoning with Cumin)

recipeInstructions.text: Place a single layer of steak in a shallow casserole dish. Sprinkle a portion of lime juice, sazón, and adobo seasoning. Top with chopped onion pieces. Repeat layers until all pieces of steak are seasoned. Pour beer over the mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, and up to 24 hours.
Discard marinade. Grill steak until lightly charred on the outside but still slightly tender in the center for medium doneness, 6 to 7 minutes per side.

review.reviewBody: Wonderfully delicious recipe for traditional Mexican Parrilla. I’ve served this flavorful and juicy barbecued steak often, in a number of different ways and to a variety of different people successfully. Every time I am traveling in Mexico I make sure to sample as many different Arracherra entrees as I can without making my dinner boring, and, although I’m encountering many different marinades that taste fantastic, this recipe is definitely one of the best I’ve had to date.
Wonderful seasonings and with the dark beer, it cooks so luscious and fragrant and TENDER!
Very very good . My family really enjoyed

Added finely chopped garlic,
Mexican oregano,
I used Corona beer,
Chile lime adobo seasoning for the marinade

The arrachera was excellent for our tacos! Per the author's notes, I did add minced garlic and cilantro to the marinade. The only changes I made were: 1) used my own salt free sazon blend instead of store bought and ended up adding a little extra adobo, and 2) used gluten free beer (tested with Omission and Two Brothers) and had no issues with the recipe. This is our new go to recipe for skirt steak tacos and look forward to making it again!
I made it last night. The meat was exceptional tender. It made great tacos. Tonight I’m going to cut thin slices and but it on top of my salad.
This recipes was easy to make and soooo good I didn’t get a pic but trust me when I say it’s all gone.

I made several different taco recipes for an event and this one was the hit of the party. That didn't surprise me though because this is how I typically make mine. It's our favorite. Don't let the bright orange of the sazon or the beer scare you. They work magic together! You really can't go wrong with this recipe. These are the best tacos you will ever eat.
